unnormalised: Local Delhi bakery, "Sweet Surrender," had a bit of a mishap this morning! Apparently, someone got their units mixed up while prepping for the day's orders. The baker, Mr. Sharma, accidentally added 500g of salt instead of 50g to his signature chocolate cake recipe. Talk about a salty surprise!
normalised: Local Delhi bakery, "Sweet Surrender," had a bit of a mishap this morning! Apparently, someone got their units mixed up while prepping for the day's orders. The baker, Mister Sharma, accidentally added five hundred gram of salt instead of fifty gram to his signature chocolate cake recipe. Talk about a salty surprise!

unnormalised: Customers who bought the cake early morning were in for a shock, with several complaining online. One tweet read, "My 1 kg cake tasted like the Dead Sea!" Sweet Surrender has apologized profusely, offering full refunds and promising a fresh batch, correctly measured this time. They're even throwing in a free box of cookies as compensation!
normalised: Customers who bought the cake early morning were in for a shock, with several complaining online. One tweet read, "My one kilogram cake tasted like the Dead Sea!" Sweet Surrender has apologized profusely, offering full refunds and promising a fresh batch, correctly measured this time. They're even throwing in a free box of cookies as compensation!

unnormalised: Mr. Sharma says he's double-checking every measurement going forward, and all new batches will be made with extra care. Let's hope this 500g/50g mix-up is a one-time thing, and "Sweet Surrender" can get back to making delicious, properly measured treats!
normalised: Mister Sharma says he's double-checking every measurement going forward, and all new batches will be made with extra care. Let's hope this five hundred gram slash fifty gram mix-up is a one-time thing, and "Sweet Surrender" can get back to making delicious, properly measured treats!
